Class FoodSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • FoodSource

  • public class FoodSource
extends Object
    this class manages the food particle it places it inside an ArrayList forming a grid The grid is the food that the ant will eat from
    Version:
    05/03/2014 16:33:53
    Author:
    CRHanna

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean addFood
      check if the food is selected from the menu.
      private int cols
      columns of the grid
      private int counter
      keep track of how many ants accessed the eatFood() and decrement the number of particles in the arraylist accordingly.
      private boolean foodStatus
      pass the status of adding or not adding food to the addBiscuit(), addSugar(), and addToxic() methods.
      grid
      arraylist grid of type Food
      private boolean hasParticle
      checks whether the ant has reached to the food.
      private PVector location
      location vector
      private int rows
      rows of the grid
      private int unitH
      width of a particle inside the grid.
      private int unitSize
      the area size of the unit.
      private int unitW
      width of a particle inside the grid.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FoodSource(PVector location, int gridSize) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBiscuit()
      this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the biscuit because its id number is 1 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type
      void addFoodIcon(float x, float y, int size, boolean selected, int type)
      this method adds the food grid arraylist whenever it is called this method is to be displayed on the menu as an icon exclusivly
      void addSugar()
      this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the sugar because its id number is 2 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type
      void addToxic()
      this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the toxic because its id number is 3 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type
      void eatFood(PVector l)
      this method simulates the event that the ant is picking food particle from the food in fact the when the ant comes to a proximity from the food a food particle will be deleted according to it sequential positioning in the arraylist and a new rectangle is drawn in Colony class creating the illusion of the ant picking up food
      boolean getFoodStatus(boolean status)
      This method is called in the Menu class in order to know whether the food was selected or not
      boolean hasParticle()
      checks whether the ant has touched the food this method is called in the eatFood method to determine whether the ant has touched to food and it is also called in the Ant class in the findFood method
      boolean noFood()
      if noFood is true addFood is false.
      boolean setFoodStatus()
      based on the information received from the getFoodStatus() method if the status is true then food can be added if the status is false then the food cannot be added
      void setGrid()
      this method builds the grid from a food particle inside the arraylist forming the food square
      boolean setSelected(boolean selected)
      this method is called in the Menu class it detrmines whether the food is selected or not it passes its boolean value to the selected valiable that in its turn returns true or false to the Food class method foodUnit

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • grid

        public  grid
        arraylist grid of type Food

      • location

        private PVector location
        location vector

      • rows

        private final int rows
        rows of the grid

      • cols

        private final int cols
        columns of the grid

      • unitW

        private final int unitW
        width of a particle inside the grid.

      • unitH

        private final int unitH
        width of a particle inside the grid.

      • unitSize

        private final int unitSize
        the area size of the unit.

      • counter

        private int counter
        keep track of how many ants accessed the eatFood() and decrement the number of particles in the arraylist accordingly.

      • hasParticle

        private boolean hasParticle
        checks whether the ant has reached to the food.

      • addFood

        private boolean addFood
        check if the food is selected from the menu.

      • foodStatus

        private boolean foodStatus
        pass the status of adding or not adding food to the addBiscuit(), addSugar(), and addToxic() methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FoodSource

        public FoodSource(PVector location,
          int gridSize)
        Parameters:
        location - is used to position the arraylist across the window
        gridSize - specifies the number of rows and columns of the grid. the amount is the same for both because grid should always remain square

    • Method Detail

      • setGrid

        public void setGrid()
        this method builds the grid from a food particle inside the arraylist forming the food square

      • noFood

        public boolean noFood()
        if noFood is true addFood is false. this method is used to keep the food from appearing at the start of the program and from keeping the ant from foraging for food if no food was selected it is called in the findFood method of the Ant class

      • getFoodStatus

        public boolean getFoodStatus(boolean status)
        This method is called in the Menu class in order to know whether the food was selected or not
        Parameters:
        status - returns true if the food was selected from the food menu
        Returns:
        returns tru if the status is true

      • setFoodStatus

        public boolean setFoodStatus()
        based on the information received from the getFoodStatus() method if the status is true then food can be added if the status is false then the food cannot be added
        Returns:
        returns true if the getFoodStatus is true

      • addBiscuit

        public void addBiscuit()
        this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the biscuit because its id number is 1 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type

      • addSugar

        public void addSugar()
        this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the sugar because its id number is 2 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type

      • addToxic

        public void addToxic()
        this method adds the food particle to the grid arraylist this food particle represents the toxic because its id number is 3 so the whole arraylist will be filled with biscuit this method is used in the Menu class in order to add food according to its type

      • addFoodIcon

        public void addFoodIcon(float x,
               float y,
               int size,
               boolean selected,
               int type)
        this method adds the food grid arraylist whenever it is called this method is to be displayed on the menu as an icon exclusivly
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        size - the size of the food icon
        selected - returns true if the food icon was selected
        type - either 1, 2 or 3

      • setSelected

        public boolean setSelected(boolean selected)
        this method is called in the Menu class it detrmines whether the food is selected or not it passes its boolean value to the selected valiable that in its turn returns true or false to the Food class method foodUnit
        Parameters:
        selected - returns true if the food icon was selected
        Returns:
        true if the food icon was selected

      • hasParticle

        public boolean hasParticle()
        checks whether the ant has touched the food this method is called in the eatFood method to determine whether the ant has touched to food and it is also called in the Ant class in the findFood method
        Returns:
        true if the ant has touched the food grid

      • eatFood

        public void eatFood(PVector l)
        this method simulates the event that the ant is picking food particle from the food in fact the when the ant comes to a proximity from the food a food particle will be deleted according to it sequential positioning in the arraylist and a new rectangle is drawn in Colony class creating the illusion of the ant picking up food
        Parameters:
        l - is the location of the ant that will be passed to this method
